pages.title: Servo Motor
pages.text: Overview $(br2)Efficiently and accurately controls two physical structures to maintain a given rotation angle/angular velocity under suitable conditions.$(br)The two motors differ only in rotation direction.
Interaction $(br2)$(li)Sneak + Right Click to assemble blocks above into a physical structure (similar to Clockwork physics bearings). Glue not supported.$(li)Use a wrench to adjust orientation.

pages.title: Control Panel
pages.text: Right Click with an empty hand to open the control panel.

Main Panel $(br2)Displays basic settings:$(br2)Current: Real-time relative angle/angular velocity (radians/radians per second).$(br2)Locked: Whether the motor is constrained.$(br2)Target: Desired angle/angular velocity (radians/radians per second).

Main Panel $(li)Mode: Select Angle or Angular Velocity target$(li)Cheat: Convenience features - NO_REPULSE disables reaction force during rotation, NO_GRAVITY removes gravity from controlled structures$(li)AutoLock: Automatically constrains the motor when:$(li)Angular Velocity mode: Target is 0$(li)Angle mode: Actual angle approaches target angle (error < 1e-3)
Redstone Panel $(br2)Configurable parameters:$(li)Output torque$(li)Target value$(li)Lock status$(br)Each parameter can be bound to multiple channels. See general redstone panel documentation.

Advanced Panel $(li)PID controller parameters. Actual output torque = (P*error + D*error_rate + I*error_integral) * MOI of controlled structure relative to its COM. Note: MOI does not include other structures connected via constraints.$(br)Do not adjust these without PID tuning knowledge.$(li)Speed Limit: Rotation speed limit in Angle mode (minimum 3 rad/s)

Advanced Panel $(li)Offset (First Line): Axis offset relative to default axis position for next assembly/connection$(li)Offset (Second Line): Controlled structure's axis offset relative to default axis position for next assembly/connection
Both motors at 57Â°. Top: Controlled structure offset adjustment. Bottom: Axis offset adjustment.
Remote Panel $(br2)Manual controls:$(li)Assembly (equivalent to Sneak + Right Click)$(li)Lock (manual constraint)$(li)Unlock (manual release)$(li)Disconnect
